title: Learning data.table Notes
text:
Preface
My notes on learning data.table.

title: Learning data.table Notes
text:
Basics

data.table()


library(data.table)
small_dtb <- data.table(x = letters[1:5],
                        y = rnorm(5),
                        z = 1:5)
small_dtb

        x          y     z
   <char>      <num> <int>
1:      a  0.7483929     1
2:      b  0.4520126     2
3:      c  1.2175161     3
4:      d  1.4380206     4
5:      e -0.3924529     5



You can also convert existing objects to a data.table using setDT() (for data.frame and list structures) or as.data.table() (for other structures).


general form DT[i, j, by] — Take DT, subset/reorder rows using i, then calculate j, grouped by by.
subset rows in i

Example:

(small_dtb[x %in% c('a', 'b', 'c', 'e') & z >= 3])

        x          y     z
   <char>      <num> <int>
1:      c  1.2175161     3
2:      e -0.3924529     5


Example:

(small_dtb[c(2, 5)])

        x          y     z
   <char>      <num> <int>
1:      b  0.4520126     2
2:      e -0.3924529     5


up to – Sort flights first by column origin in ascending order, and then by dest in descending order:
